task_summary: Robot arm locates, approaches, and picks up the red object from the table surface in a sequential plan.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm operates on a tabletop to pick up a single red object (visibly cylindrical) from the table. The workspace contains visual markers and another static blue item. The task requires perception, approach, fine alignment, contact detection, and stable grasp before lifting the object. Constraints include ensuring the correct object is picked, robust grasp, and preventing disturbance of other objects.
preconditions: Red object is present and detectable on the table
stepwise_plan: Verify the red object is visible; search if not
Detect or localize the red object
Move above the red object at a safe offset
Approach and align above the object with precision
Confirm grasp stability and that object is held
Lift (raise) the object from the table by 5 cm
success_criteria: Red object is securely in gripper
Object has been lifted off the table
No objects besides the red object are moved
failure_and_recovery: If red object is not detected: scan again up to 3 times
If grasp is unstable: abort or retry the sequence
If collision detected: stop and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Behavior terminates upon successfully grasping and lifting the red object from the table surface.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible to the camera.
Performs up to 3 raster scans to locate the red object if not visible.
Detects and localizes the red object.
Opens the gripper in preparation for grasp.
Moves the gripper above the red object with a 5cm offset.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the red object.
Approaches and aligns above the red object to within 5mm tolerance.
Lowers end effector towards the object until 5N contact is detected or 5cm depth reached.
Closes the gripper with 10N force to grasp the red object.
Checks if the grasp on the object is stable.
Ensures the red object is currently held by the gripper.
Raises the held red object by 5cm to lift it from the table.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan for object visibility up to 3 times
Abort sequence if grasp remains unstable or object not in gripper
assumptions: Red object is the only manipulable object; frames confirm a single cylindrical red item.
No explicit placement step is present in episode; last frames show object has been lifted.
The instruction requests 'pick up', so only the pick and lift are modeled.
Table is ordinary; blue object is ignored, as per visual evidence.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is securely lifted off the table by at least 5cm
